results.title: Drugs: The Children are choosing - The Need for dialogue
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
Reports on a conference in which students and teachers have difficulties in communicating about drugs. Finally the frustrations and problems childhood emerge and it is suggested that it is no wonder young people turn to drugs for escape and pleasure.

results.title: Drugs and Medicines
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Using them safely
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs and Medicines”
Safely using either prescription or non-prescription drugs and medicines requires reading the label and following the directions, storing them in a safe place and avoiding leftover medicine

results.title: What is misuse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs and Medicine”.
Drug abuse means more than just addiction to harmful drugs. A neighbourhood pharmacist talks about the kinds of drugs and medicines being misused. His relations with his customers offer examples of varying degrees of misuse.

results.title: Doubts and Certainties
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: A.S. Neill
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Doubts and Certainties”.
An interview with A. S. Neil, headmaster of the pioneer school of Summerhill in Suffolk for fifty years. Here he discusses Hunkin and his belief that education must not be indoctrination and that the child’s emotions should be completely free.

results.title: Building belief. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
Dorothy Heathcote continues her work with a class of nine and ten year old American children. Using drama to create focus and feeling, she poses three moral dilemmas, where the children are confronted with crises involving leadership, old-age, and death. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Building belief. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
This film shows England’s outstanding drama educator, Dorothy Heathcote, working with nine and ten year old American children. She uses drama as a means of teaching social studies. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Dorothy Heathcote talks to teachers. Pt. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
In a teachers’ workshop, Dorothy Heathcote, England’s outstanding drama educator, explores the theory of improvised drama as a teaching tool for all classroom teachers. She analyses her unique process, explaining and illustrating techniques for developing materials, the use of dramatic elements and the segmenting of ideas to achieve dramatic focus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University
